com.inqwell.any.client.swing

Interface InqEditor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnyComponentEditor, JTable.TreeTableCellEditor

    public interface InqEditor
    An additional interface implemented by Inq cell editors that provides additional methods through which the GUI and Inq script cooperate.

    In addition, some native cell editor methods are repeated to allow them to be accessed in the context of an InqEditor reference.

    Author:
    Tom

    • Method Detail

      • canStartEditing

        boolean canStartEditing(AnyComponent parentComponent,
                        Any contextNode,
                        Any rowRoot,
                        Any value,
                        int row,
                        Any rowKey,
                        int col,
                        Any colName,
                        TreeLevel level,
                        BooleanI isLeaf,
                        BooleanI expanded)
        Determine whether editing should be started in the specified cell.
        Parameters:
        parentComponent - the parent tree, table or list
        contextNode - the current context
        rowRoot - root node from which cell value is referenced
        value - value of cell
        row - row number
        col - column in model coordinates (table and tree table only)
        colName - column name, if available (table and tree table only)
        isLeaf - if a tree editor, whether the node is a leaf. Null if not a tree
        expanded - if a tree editor, whether the node is expanded. Null if not a tree
        Returns:
        true if editing can be started, false if it cannot

      • hasStopEdit

        boolean hasStopEdit()
        Whether this editor has a scripted function that will be called when editing stops.
        Returns:
        true if we have a function, false otherwise.
